localised_text.tooltip_text: Auto-resolve||Automatically resolve the battle if you have a clear advantage over the enemy. However, you will have a better chance at victory should you fight the battle manually.
Continue Siege||Continue the siege in order to construct further siege equipment, or attempt to wait out the enemy rather than assaulting.
Scout terrain||Display a preview of the battle map.
Break Siege||Lift the siege and retreat. After reviewing the enemy details you may decide that the siege will not end in your favour.

Retreat||Retreat from the battle. After reviewing the enemy details you may decide that the battle will not end in your favour. Should you be attacked again following the retreat, you will not be able to retreat a second time.
Spectate||Watch the other player fight the battle. You cannot be gifted units as a spectator, you must be in support of defender or attacker in order to be gifted units.
Encircle||Surround the settlement and wait out the enemy rather than attacking head-on.

seductive_influence_tracker.comment: Property setter is for handling sort, we do +1 so that those without resource at least sorted above those without resource

allies_combatants_panel.comment: This gets passed CcoCampaignCharacter from code (cco of the commander)

dy_attrition.componentleveltooltip: Turns remaining until supplies run out and garrison starts suffering [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition

dy_construction_effort.componentleveltooltip: Labour force available per turn||This is the amount of labour you can use per turn to construct siege engines. The amount you use will be subtracted from the total labour force.

dy_construction_strength.componentleveltooltip: Total labour force||The labour force is used to construct siege engines for use in the upcoming assault. The size of your army determines the amount of labour available during a siege; the larger the army, the more labour is available.

dy_description.componentleveltooltip: Your force's predicted strength||Your generals and admirals always try to predict the outcome of the battle as best as they can, but if they lack experience, the displayed values might be inaccurate. The accuracy of the prediction is based on your leader's experience level compared to the opposing leader's.||The white box indicates the margin of error of your general's prediction.

component_text.text: Your forces attack an army of France

dy_turns.componentleveltooltip: Turns remaining until garrison is wiped out from [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition

newstate.name: NewState
newstate.tooltip: You cannot starve out a port settlement through siege alone - it must also be blockaded by a fleet.

newstate.name: NewState
newstate.tooltip: You cannot starve out a port settlement through siege alone - it must also be blockaded by a fleet.

killometer.componentleveltooltip: Balance of Power||The greater the proportion of yellow on this bar, the greater the military superiority your army has over that of your opponent, and vice versa.

label_tx.componentleveltooltip: Initiate the battle with a lightning strike manoeuvre.||Lightning strike battles will prevent reinforcements from arriving for both forces participating in the battle. However, your forces will started the battle with reduced Vigour.
Controlling a large army allows you to take up to 40 units onto the battlefield at once, without waiting for reinforcements.

newstate.name: NewState
newstate.tooltip: Action Points||The green bar represents the remaining movement points this force has left. When the green bar is empty, the force will be unable to move until the next turn.

turns_center.componentleveltooltip: Construction turns left||You are currently building this item.
Construction turns left||You are currently building this item.

component_text.text: Siege vehicles are not available for this battle.
The battle will take place outside the settlement.
Siege equipment is unavailable to the Ogre Kingdoms.
The battle will take place outside the settlement.

dy_units.componentleveltooltip: Number of units that can be seduced

default.name: default
default.tooltip: Entity & unit size||This is a unit of large entities.||This displays the current unit size compared to the maximum unit size. Units will replenish over time when in owned territory or certain stances.

callback_with_context.context_function_id: Format("%s: %d%%", Loc("wall_strength"), RoundFloat(WallsHealthPercent * 100)) + GetIfElse(NumWallBreaches > 0, Format(" %s: %d", Loc("num_breaches"), NumWallBreaches), "")

autoresolve_visibility_parent.comment: This is parent that gets visibility toggled by dev ui button, so separate to dev ui parent whose visibility determined by if dev ui enabled or not

default.name: default
default.tooltip: The settlement's gates will be open during the battle.
